intro: Statice minuta var. sommieriana, commonly known as the dwarf statice or summer statice, is a compact, flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that come in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it ideal for rock gardens or as a bedding plant. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with the stems often branching at the base. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, blooming from late spring to early autumn.
